plugins.adufour.vars.gui
Class VarEditor<T>

java.lang.Object
  plugins.adufour.vars.gui.VarEditor<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the inner type of the corresponding variable
All Implemented Interfaces:
VarListener<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
CheckBox, ComboBox, FileChooser, FilesChooser, SequenceChooser, Spinner, SwimmingObjectChooser, TextField
public abstract class VarEditor<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements VarListener<T>

Class defining a graphical component that may receive user input

Author:
Alexandre Dufour

Method Detail

createEditorComponent

protected abstract javax.swing.JComponent createEditorComponent()
Creates the GUI component uses to receive user input.
NOTE for developers: this method is called during object construction, therefore overriding methods should not refer to local instance fields, as they will only be initialized at the end of the construction chain.

Returns:
a Swing JComponent that is linked to the variable and can be used to view or adjust the variable value

getEditorComponent

public javax.swing.JComponent getEditorComponent()

getVariable

public Var<T> getVariable()

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
Enables (or disables) the editor component such that it allows user input. Note that this method also registers (or unregisters) the appropriate listeners to avoid excessive firing and ensure proper resource cleaning

activateListeners

protected abstract void activateListeners()
Activates all custom listeners for the editor component

deactivateListeners

Deactivates all custom listeners for the editor component

setInterfaceValue

protected abstract void setInterfaceValue(T newValue)
Adjusts the graphical interface value to the specified. Note that it is not necessary that the implementation of this method triggers a change event

Parameters:
newValue -

dispose

public void dispose()
Dispose of resources (e.g. listeners, IO etc.) before releasing the editor. This method must be called by overriding implementations to ensure proper cleaning
